result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyjuan D Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO THIS CASE:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees, from cash bail on deposit, or if not paid, CIVIL JUDGMENT. Cash bail to apply.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to CT 2 and and cases 2014CF1703 and 2014CF1213.**  Credit for zero days.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one  and cases 2014CF1703 and 2014CF1213.  Credit for 104 days.

records.addlTxt:
The following clerical error was made in the Judgment of Conviction on case 2014CF572:

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2 and any other sentences), in the House of Correection with credit for 0 days time served.  

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1 and any other sentences), in the House of Correction with credit for 104 days time served.  
*
Correction:

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2 and cases 2014CF1703 and 2014CF1213), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1 and cases 2014CF1703 and 2014CF1213), in the House of Correction with credit for 104 days time served.
*
Order, signed and filed.   mld

Attorney Daryl A. Kastenson in court, defendant Tyjuan D Ford not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court waived the appearance of defendant, upon the request of defense counsel.  Bail / Bond Motion withdrawn by defense counsel.  Sentencing Hearing rescheduled in Branch 4 from 9-30-2014 at 1:30 pm to 9-5-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Upon the request of defense counsel, Sentencing Hearing rescheduled in branch 4 from 9-3-2014 at 8:30 am to 9-30-2014 at 1:30 pm.  ADA Nicolas Heitman and Attorney Daryl Kastenson were both present and advise of the new court date.   mld
Presentence Investigation Report, received and filed.   mld

Due to the unavailability of ADA Heitman, Sentencing hearing reschedled to 9-3-2014 at 8:30 am.   Rescheduled date of 9-3-2014 confirmed with Attorney Kastenson via telephone and ADA Heitman via email.   mld
Presentence Investigation Report, received and filed.   mld

ADA Nicolas Heitman and Attorney Daryl Kastenson were both present and advised that due to the unavailability of the court on 8-7-2014, Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to branch 4 on 8-28-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Tyjuan D Ford in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Tyjuan D Ford in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1 and COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 8-7-2014 at 8:30 am.  PSI without recommendation ordered by the Court.  The Court ordered the defendant remanded pending sentencing.    mld
NEW COUNT #2: Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 943.14, a Class A Misdemeanor."  Amended Information to be filed by the State.  mld

Defendant Tyjuan D Ford in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Tyjuan D Ford in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 "On states motion, Court AMENDED the Charge to COUNT #1: Disorderly Conduct, (Domestic Abuse), contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 947.01(1) and 968.075(1)(a), a Class B Misdemeanor."  This now makes this charge a misdemeanor.   mld

Defendant Tyjuan D Ford in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Tyjuan D Ford in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Tyjuan D Ford not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Off the record.  Upon the request of parties, Pretrial Conference rescheduled to branch 4 on 3-3-2014 at 8:30 am.  Defendant has a new case (2014CF572), scheduled for Preliminary Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-3-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant was arrested earlier this morning by MPD on case 2014CF572.  Victim was present.  The Court took no statement by the victim due to the new case.  Court defers on a statement from the victim until the next hearing date.   Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 2-25-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Tyjuan D Ford in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Kristin M Schrank appeared with Patrick Leigl (under the student practice rule), for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Daryl Anderson.  Exhibit 1 marked for identification.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the discovery from the State.  Offer will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.   Case is adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 2-20-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail, including the no contact order are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Tyjuan D Ford in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Tyjuan D Ford in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
